title: The X Factor: Celebrity divides viewers as Simon Cowell’s revamped show kicks off
text:
What did you make of X Factor: Celebrity? (Picture: ITV)

The X Factor: Celebrity kicked off with a mix of Love Island supergroups and moving tributes from Martin Bashir, but not everyone was entirely sold on the concept.

In the first episode of the series, judges Simon Cowell, Louis Walsh, and Nicole Scherzinger were joined by a bunch of celebrity pals as a number of famous faces auditioned at Simon’s Malibu home.

So who impressed? The Chase’s Jenny Ryan proved the biggest standout, delivering a stunning cover of Queen’s Somebody To Love.

On the other end of the scale was duo Jeremy Edwards and Brendan Cole, with the former getting particularly bitter toward the judges after some negative comments.

Wes Nelson, Eyal Booker, Samira Mighty and Zara McDermott (Picture: Dymond/Thames/Syco/REX)

Falling somewhere in the middle were the Love Island supergroup, comprised of Wes Nelson, Eyal Booker, Samira Mighty and Zara McDermott, with the former showing off his surprisingly decent rapping skills.

An unlikely highlight was Martin Bashir, who provided a touching moment as he revealed how his late brother inspired him to sign up for the show.

But how did the show go down with viewers? Some fully embraced the lighter, sillier tone.

I’m actually enjoying #XFactor for the first time in years! #XFactorCelebrity 🥰 — Hannah Morgans (@HannahMorganss) October 12, 2019

Well that was exactly what the country needed at this time. Well done Cowell. #XFactorCelebrity — Charlie Evans 🏴󠁧󠁢󠁷󠁬󠁳󠁿 (@cde1993) October 12, 2019

I’m sorry but I actually really enjoyed XFactor Celebrities #XFactorCelebrity — Tilly 🌟🐻💂🏻‍♀️ (@X1_Tilly) October 12, 2019

Thoroughly enjoyed #XFactorCelebrity, even if Martin Bashir was the only face I recognised! — Ros Dodd (@ros_dodd) October 12, 2019

Others however weren’t quite so sold on it.

This is so weirdddd 😂😂😂 #XFactorCelebrity — Shanaè (@shanaetiaminaj) October 12, 2019

Well that was bloody awful. This is not the route to go down. Talk about scraping the barrel #XFactorCelebrity — Lindsay (@LindsayBint) October 12, 2019

#XFactorCelebrity this is sooooooo bad. Please cancel x factor and all Simon cowells shows. They have had their day . — Julie Tucker (@mollykins64) October 12, 2019

Or maybe cringe is the way forward?

Well #XFactorCelebrity was a cringefest but I know I'll continue watching — Aaron Long (@_AaronLong_) October 12, 2019

A cracking Saturday cringe.

This isn’t the only revamped version of The X Factor coming this year, with an all stars version featuring past contestants also set to air later this year.

The X Factor: Celebrity continues next Saturday on ITV.
